availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Requisitions for the Return of Fugitives from Justice, 1863-1867

body.p: This day personally appeared before the undersigned a Notary Public, Andrew L. Robinson who after being sworn deposes and swears that the written named John W. Rutherford since the commission of the crime charged against him in the foregoing indictment has left the State of Indiana and is at the present term residing in the County of Crittenden in the Commonwealth of Kentucky

p.stamp:
C. E. M.
Not Pub
May 16, 1865

body.p: Sworn to and subscribed before me Chas E. Marsh a Notary Public within and for said county this this 15th day of May A. D. 1865 as witness my hand and Notorial seal this date aforesaid

V.C.C.
The State of Indiana vs John W. Rutherford
Copy of Indictment
costs of transcript $3.00
Paid by Maj Robinson
Blythe Hynes
Sec. state will issue requisition as asked -- See letter of instructions herewith from Mr Robinson

By order Govr
C. P. Jacobs
Priv. Secy --
